Posts.Content: Welcome booth1986 sorry you have been diagnoised with Dcis,I was older than you last year when I was diagnosed at 46, it's so scary thinking of what the next weeks and months hold for you. As far as I know chemo isn't used to treat Dcis, it would only be needed if an invasive cancer was found. I had a lumpectomy and 20 sessions of radiation and now a year on I'm doing good, but I remember how frightened I was at the start so afraid.let us know how you get on what's the next step for you.
Posts.Title: Hi I've just been diagnosed with dcis I'm 31 and am awaiting an op...

Posts.Content: Are you on medicatio? I'm taking Tamixofen since March1st the 2nd month I was given a different brand and I had hot flushes all the time I went back to the original brand and I'm fine I have the odd on pe now if you Re on medication could you try a different brand maybe hot flushes are a curse.
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: I feel like you do Ossy, I had 2 lumpectomies in Octobe, Novembe, then radiation for the month of january, I was feeling lucky it was caught, I had Paget's and Dcis so not invasive, but now after treatment I feel really really angry and I think in the last month or 2 the severity of all this has only hit me as I was fine had my treatment but when it finished I was feeling so so down crying all the time feeling dread when I thought about returning to work, my family and Husband included think I'm grand cured and all ok, but I don't feel like that I went to the Dr she said I'm suffering from post traumatic stress disorder she gave me anti depressants( which I decided not to take) we went to Spain last week on holidays and I'm feeling much better this week after returning home, could you take a little break maybe? It's great we all know how we are feeling and have been here and can support each other.
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: I know how you fell I was devastated last year to find I had Paget's diseSe and Dcis and had to have my nipple removed the first week or 2 I was devastated having palpitations and all then I just had the operation (2) operations I didn't have chemo and I had 20 sessions of radiation which I struggled with I was very emotional then after that in April may I was very very down feeling of dread my DR said I was suffering from post traumatic stress and she said it's very common cause your having treatment appointments etc then your finished and you don't know what to do and it all hits you, I haven't even gone back to work yet but I'm working on going back part time in September. I think it's normal to feel down maybe some counselling (I haven't had any yet but am thinking of it) just wanted to let you know it's normal and your not alone
Posts.Title: Recovery.

Posts.Content: I'm interested about this too, I didn't  have a mastectomy but I'd my nipple removed and I'm finding it quiet difficult having no nipple my DR said they would tattoo a nipple,and he would correct any size difference , (I had 2 operations and radiation) however having lived with no nipple since October I'm sure I want a reconstruction,I will watch with interest as well
Posts.Title: Nipple reconstruction....or not?

Posts.Content: I had lumpectomy and radiation my breast is firmer and higher while my other breast is hanging down etc, I, having a reduction at my request I've been Waiting ages I had a nipple reconstruction and my breast rounded. Out although it's still a bit square on the Pagets side, no implants etc. I'm excited about this but I'm quiet worried about the scarring as I will be cut all around my nipple and this moved up scarred underneath also, no implant, how does this work ( I don't want an implant) I'm just saying no implant just breast reduced to match the other one does this work out well I don't really know what I'm asking just any advise really I'm having the surgery on 12th July.
Posts.Title: Reduction on non cancer breast experiences please

Posts.Content: Thank you both for taking the time to reply, and thanks for the silicone recommendation I'll try get that online too and have it ready looking forward and a bit apprehensive excited then a tattoo and put this chapter behind me thank you.
Posts.Title: Reduction on non cancer breast experiences please

Posts.Content: That's meant to read showed me pictures of his work.
Posts.Title: Reduction on non cancer breast experiences please

Posts.Content: I received my letter today for my reduction having it next Thursday I don't know if I'm nervous or delighted, I've waited a long time but I'm afraid It won't be a good outcome my dr did show me pictures of hi Suzanne work and they all looked good but these were both breasts reduced due to back issues he will be doing one only reducing to match my cancer one I've alaways been large chested and this is all strange too I don't mind the operation being put to sleep none of that just nervous of the actual outcome
Posts.Title: Reduction on non cancer breast experiences please

Posts.Content: A year ago today It's a year ago today that I got my diagnosis, it's kind of surreal looking back the utter shock when the DR at the breast clinic told me the terror I felt, thinking I'd be leaving my fab husband and my 3 children, thinking what's life all about being so afraid.itsa year on I'd 2 lumpectomies and a month of radiation that was tough looking back I dunno how I did it. I had good support from my family friends and my work were fantastic, I returned to work recently and I'm all good and back to normal.Thank God for modern medicine,or it may have been a very different story. For anyone who's had a diagnosis recently or going through treatment try to think positive and get through the days, weeks and months, cause before you know it you'll be like me a year out and amazed by how strong you actually are, hugs to all.
Posts.Title: A year ago today

Posts.Content: Happy birthday, Batfinkcaz, I thought I'd reply because I'm 47 tomorrow, I had my lumpectomy on the 13th October last year, and I wanted to cancel my Birthday last year it was dreadful, bit my Husband and kids insisted on celebrating, I always hated getting older and NEVER told people my age I hated saying I was 40 anything but now I'm delighted to be getting older and this will be a much happier Birthday enjoy your birthday xx
Posts.Title: A birthday i thought I'd never reach...
